caption:
This photograph depicts a baker in a bakery setting. The baker, a middle-aged man with a stocky build and light skin, is wearing a white baker's uniform consisting of a short-sleeved shirt and pants, which are slightly dusted with flour. He also wears a traditional white paper hat on his head. He is smiling and looking directly at the camera, exuding a sense of pride and contentment.

In his hands, he is holding two large, freshly baked loaves of bread, characterized by a golden-brown crust. The loaves are rectangular and appear to be quite soft and fluffy; each is quite sizable, extending the length of his forearm.

In the background, there is a metal rack filled with similar loaves of bread, some wrapped in plastic bags stacked neatly on the shelves. Behind the baker, a partial view of an industrial baking oven can be observed, suggesting the setting is indeed a bakery's kitchen. The lighting in the space gives a warm glow, emphasizing the freshness and warm appeal of the baked goods. The overall ambiance reflects a busy, productive environment likely filled with the aromatic scents of freshly baked bread.
title: Homemade bread and sweet rolls are made daily by Jim Tillman of Tillman's Bakery. It is the only one remaining that concentrates only on baked goods. Each night Tillman and one assistant make the bread and rolls that will be bought by residents. Tillman's make the traditional German bread and sweet sugared and glazed rolls. New Ulm is a country seat trading center in southern Minnesota founded by German immigrants.
